repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: Mildred F. Taylor was a Republican from Lyons, Wayne County, NY. Taylor was a delegate to the Republican National Convention from New York, 1940, 1948, 1952 (alternate), 1960; a member of the New York Republican State Executive Committee, 1945; and a representative of Wayne County for the Assembly of the New York State Legislature, 1946-1960. Taylor also served as a prominent member of the Ways and Means Committee and the Joint Committee on Historic Sites.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Biogtaphical Sketch
bioghist.p: Mildred Frick Taylor was born in Lyons, New York. She attended public school and graduated from Rochester Business Institiute. Taylor was a prominent Republican member of the Assembly of the New York State Legislature between the years 1940-1960. While also attending various nominationg conventions, including the National Conventions of 1940 and 1952, Taylor served on the Ways and Means Committee, the Standing Comittee on the affairs of villages, and the Joint Committee on Historic Sites. Taylor was also extremly active in Wayne County, New York. Taylor's interests included the preservation of historic sites, the creation of the New York State Thruway, and the designation of the "Rose" as the offical flower of the State of New York. In her spare time, she was an active member of the Republican party and a member of the National Order of Women Legislators, the D.A.R., the Business and Professional WOmen's Clubs and the Order of the Easten Star.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence between other members of the Assembly of the New York State Legislature, prominent members of the Republican party, constituents, and historical societies; bills introduced to the Ways and Means Committee; documents on the preservation of hisotircal sites; brouchures from various museums; and statistics and voter registrations from the Wayne County Repbulican Committee. Also included are maps of various historic sites and projects that Taylor worked on.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged alphabetically for each series.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Mildred Taylor donated all items except documents on historic preservation to Howard L. Applegate, the Administrator of Manuscripts at the Syracuse University Library in 1967. After recieving documents on historic preservation, all items were transfered to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives in

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted.

prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Mildred Taylor Papers, 1921-1970
